title: Understanding the Basics
text: Column chromatography is a technique used to separate compounds based on their different affinities for the stationary and mobile phases. Can you identify what these phases are?

title: Role of the Stationary Phase
text: The stationary phase in column chromatography is typically a solid material packed into a column. What role does it play in the separation process?

title: Mobile Phase Movement
text: The mobile phase moves through the column, carrying the compounds with it. How does the movement of the mobile phase affect the separation of compounds?

hintAnswer: Different affinities of compounds for the stationary and mobile phases
title: Identifying the Principle
text: What is the principle behind the separation of compounds in column chromatography?
choices: Different affinities of compounds for the stationary and mobile phases
The boiling points of the compounds
The pH of the mobile phase
